TopicTitle: Fun way to destroy debris! Guide-able rockets.

Articles.Content:
So I saw people searching for military mods.

Oh,come on! Use your imagination.

I was a little bored yesterday to destroy 20+ of debris.But then an idea came up.Destroy debris with rockets!

So I strapped some SolidFuelRockets with a computer on top,and made a ship to fly those "heat seeking" rockets to space to destroy my debris.

All I had to do is to switch to computer with sfr,and click space.It detached the rocket,and ignited it to fly.

And so I guided a rocket to debris...KaBoooOm!

So the point is,make a solid fuel rocket with a small computer on top,make it detachable from main rocket,launch em to space,detach rocket and fly it to your target.Vanilla rocks!

Edit: You can use liquid fuel rockets,with wings,asas or torque wheels. I thought about that before,but that wasn't very realistic.Well,different people like different things! Hope you found everything useful ^^

Sorry for my bad English,and please,tell me if I made mistakes

If someome wants pics,I can make em.Just a little lazy to do it right now.

But the hard part is actually hitting the debris, especially if you thrust far enough back to get some good hitting speed.
And there is no guarantees that such collision won't create even MORE debris.
Want more control? Use liquid fuelled rockets. And maybe add a solid-powered impactor as it's second stage.
I've made a pegasus type launcher and done the exact same thing. It can actually get pretty high.

Not a missle but I did make a single stage rocket that got to 100k with only 12 parts.

4x parachutes (radial)

1x command pod (the little one)

1x stack separator

1x fuel tank

1x quad adapter

4x LV-30 engines

Granted that "one" fuel tank was using the stretchy tank mod and was quite long....

Could have gotten it into orbit possibly but I just let it all fall back down to kerbin.
